turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Easter Rising.
turn.1: What happened during the Battle of the Somme?
turn.2: The area saw some of the fiercest fighting of the Rising and the British had taken heavy casualties for little gain.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: General Maxwell attempted to excuse the killings and argued that the rebels were ultimately responsible.
turn.6: He claimed that "the rebels wore no uniform" and that the people of North King Street were rebel sympathisers.
turn.7: Did he have any other points of view on the battle?
turn.8: Maxwell concluded that such incidents "are absolutely unavoidable in such a business as this" and that "under the circumstance the troops [...] behaved with the greatest restraint".
turn.9: What else did you find interesting about the article?
turn.10: A private brief, prepared for the Prime Minister, said the soldiers "had orders not to take any prisoners" but took it to mean they were to shoot any suspected rebel.
turn.11: Did they recieve any punishments for the battle?
turn.12: The City Coroner's inquest found that soldiers had killed "unarmed and unoffending" residents.
